== Main Inclusion Report for audit ==

=== Requirements ===

# ''Availability:'' <nowiki>[[http://archive.ubuntu.com/ubuntu/pool/universe/a/audit]]</nowiki>; available for all supported architectures
# ''Rationale:''
** Build dependency of xorg-server (libaudit-dev)
 0. ''Security:''
** <nowiki>[[http://cve.mitre.org/cgi-bin/cvekey.cgi?keyword=audit|CVE entries]]</nowiki>: CVE-2008-1628
** auditd runs as root
** binaries in /sbin
** auditd can receive audit messages from remote hosts, but it's not used by default
** No source code review done by Ubuntu AFAIK, but it's used in RHEL for some time..
 0. ''Quality assurance:''
** The package works OOTB
** Does not ask any debconf questions
** <nowiki>[[http://bugs.debian.org/src:audit|Debian bugs]]</nowiki>: only one, which can't be reproduced by the maintainer
** <nowiki>[[http://packages.qa.debian.org/a/audit.html|Maintenance in Debian]]</nowiki> is active
** <nowiki>[[http://people.redhat.com/sgrubb/audit/|Upstream]]</nowiki> is active
** <nowiki>[[https://bugzilla.redhat.com/buglist.cgi?query_format=advanced&classification=Fedora&product=Fedora Hosted Projects&component=audit&bug_status=NEW&bug_status=ASSIGNED|Upstream bug tracker]]</nowiki>: No critical bugs
 0. ''UI standards:''
** No gui apps
 0. ''Standards compliance:'' 
** FHS, DP compliant
** debhelper packaging with quilt
 0. ''Dependencies:''
** build-deps have libprelude-dev, libev-dev which are not in main
 0. ''Maintenance:''
** Does't seem like it would need too much maintenance
** The Debian maintainer seems to be monitoring upstream, and pushing fixes there
 0. ''Internationalization:''
** No graphical apps that need i18n
